m:MaterialTitle.title: Note
m:MaterialTitle.description: This component will work only on touch screen devices but you can set any action button to be an alternative for swiping on desktop devices.

m:MaterialTitle.title: Markup
m:MaterialTitle.description: Wrap your items with MaterialSwipeablePanel to make it swipeable.

m:MaterialLabel.text: You can swipe native components. This is a plain label
This is another Card Component that is swipeable.
This is another Card Component that is swipeable.

m:MaterialPanel.demo:PrettyPre:
<m.addins:MaterialSwipeablePanel shadow="1" backgroundColor="white" padding="12">
<!-- MaterialLabel -->
<m:MaterialLabel text="You can swipe native components. This is a plain label" backgroundColor="yellow" padding="12" />
<!-- MaterialCard -->
<m:MaterialCard ui:field="card1">
<m:MaterialCardContent>
<m:MaterialLabel text="This is another Card Component that is swipeable." />
</m:MaterialCardContent>
</m:MaterialCard>
<!-- MaterialCard -->
<m:MaterialCard ui:field="card2" backgroundColor="blue" textColor="white">
<m:MaterialCardContent>
<m:MaterialLabel text="This is another Card Component that is swipeable." />
</m:MaterialCardContent>
</m:MaterialCard>
</m.addins:MaterialSwipeablePanel>

m:MaterialTitle.title: Swipe Right / Left

m:MaterialTitle.title: Disable Items
m:MaterialTitle.description: You can easily disable swipeable elements by calling the container's method setDisable(widget1, widget2, ...)

m:MaterialPanel.demo:PrettyPre:
<m.addins:MaterialSwipeablePanel ui:field="swipeableDisablePanel" shadow="1" backgroundColor="white" padding="12">
<!-- Item 1 -->
<m:MaterialLabel padding="12" text="Swipeable Item 1" shadow="1"/>
<!-- Item 2 -->
<m:MaterialLabel ui:field="item2" padding="12" text="Swipeable Item 2 (Disabled)" shadow="1"/>
<!-- Item 3 -->
<m:MaterialLabel ui:field="item3" padding="12" text="Swipeable Item 3 (Disabled)" shadow="1"/>
</m.addins:MaterialSwipeablePanel>
